qa_pairs.question: Ano ang nangyari sa mga butterflies habang naglalakad sa forest?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang mga butterflies ay pinatay ng mga monyet, na isang halimbawa ng pakikipaglaban sa pagkakapantay-pantay sa kapwa.
qa_pairs.context:
The Monkeys 
and the Butterflies 
DEEP IN A FOREST in Agusan lived many monkeys and but- 
terflies. They gave no trouble to each other, for while the 
monkeys ate the fruits of the forest trees, the butterflies 
drank the nectar from the flowers. 
But one day the monkeys decided to kill the butterflies. 
“This is our forest,” they said. “We want no butterflies 
around.” 
So they picked up sticks and marched to the glade 
where the butterflies were flitting about from flower to 
flower and sippin

qa_pairs.question: Anong pinaghuhugutan ni butterfly habang hinamon ang mga monyet?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Sa pamamagitan ng pag-aalay ng kanyang buhay, sinabi ng butterfly na ang kapantayan sa kapwa ay mahalaga at dapat ipaglaban.

qa_pairs.question: Who suggested that the monkey and the butterfly should live together without quarreling?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: In Filipino culture, respecting the boundaries of others is a crucial aspect of community living. The butterfly's proposal for peaceful coexistence serves as an example of this value.
qa_pairs.context:

and night. We only drink nectar from the flowers, and that 
harms nobody. On the other hand, if we do not carry 
pollen from one flower to another, no seeds will grow, and 
if there are no seeds, very soon you monkeys will have no 
fruit to eat. Young seeds that get no pollen do not grow.” 
“What do you think we should do?” asked the monkey. 
“You and I should agree to let each other alone,” replied 
the butterfly. “Just continue eating the

qa_pairs.question: What was the plan devised by the Eel, Catfish, and Bee to scare away the Old Man and his Wife from their house?
qa_pairs.answer: They planned to frighten them away so that they could have the house for themselves.
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: In some Filipino settings, sharing a living space is often viewed as an opportunity for communal bonding. However, in this passage, the plan devised by the Eel, Catfish, and Bee highlights a more individualistic approach to homeownership.

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang pangalan ng principe na naging lalaki sa tuktok ng puno?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Si Monkey Prince ay isang karakter na may kakaibang pag-uugalian, na nagsisilbing simbolo ng mga pagbabago at pag-usbong sa buhay.
qa_pairs.context:
Husband (groaning in the yard): Ouch! Ai! Ouch! 
Wife: What happened to you? 
Husband: Ouch! Ai! Ai! Ouch! 
Wife: There are evil spirits in the house! When I dipped 
water from the jar, something wounded me. And 
when I blew into the fire, something stung me and 
now my lips are swollen. Tell me what happened to 
you. 
Husband: There must indeed be evil spirits here. When I 
was coming down the ladder, somebody pushed me 
to the ground. We better leave this house. 
(In a hurry the Old Man and hi

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang layunin ng alagad ng diwa sa kung ano'y gawaing ito?
qa_pairs.answer: Upang magtanim ang mga asawa nito sa kalunsay at maging malaya sila sa kaharian ng lalaki
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang layunin ng alagad ng diwa ay upang matuklasan ang kasabihang ' Pag-uugali ang pag-usbong', na nagsasaad na ang pagbabago at pag-usbong sa buhay ay maaaring magkaroon ng isang bagong anyo.

qa_pairs.question: What was transformed into a wild forest?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: The transformation of the proud city into a wild forest, reminiscent of the Filipino concept of 'sari-saring kapantay' (various forms) where humans and animals coexist in harmony with nature.
qa_pairs.context:
So saying, she returned to the dark forest. 
No sooner had she turned her back than the proud city 
became a wild forest. The king and all his subjects were 
changed into lizards, snakes, wild pigs, jungle fowl, croco- 
diles, and other animals of the forest. Also, just as the witch 
had said, Ukay became a monkey. He climbed up into a 
tree and said nothing but “Kra-kra-kra!” all day long. 
The years dragged on one by one and Ukay and his 
people remained in their animal forms. The neighboring

qa_pairs.question: How long did Ukay and his people remain in their animal forms?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: For over four hundred years, Ukay and his people remained in their animal forms, reflecting the Filipino value of 'tiis-bilog' (enduring patience) as they waited for a chance to break the witch's curse.

qa_pairs.question: Sino ang prinsipe na nagkamay sa binata?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang magandang batang principe, na isinilang ng pangunahing prinsipal at bayaning babae, na nagpakita ng matapang at makabayan na pagkatao ng mga taga-Bukidnon.

qa_pairs.question: Anong pangalan ng kabataan na Manobo?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang lalaking binatang Manobo, na may buhay na mabuting pagkatao at isip, na nagpakita ng pagmamahal sa kapwa at katotohanan.

qa_pairs.question: What is the reason for the princess's confinement?
qa_pairs.answer: To keep her from the eyes of admirers
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: In Filipino culture, it was not uncommon for families to keep their daughters confined in high towers or strict supervision to protect them from external influences and potential suitors. This practice is rooted in traditional values emphasizing family honor and reputation.
qa_pairs.context:
spare our lives and we will give you magic power.” 
“What magic power?” he asked. 
The rat held out three strands of hair, and in its mouth 
the snake held out three clean feathers. “Take these,” they 
said. “You only have to rub them on the dead to bring 
them back to life,” 
The man took the feathers and hair and said, “T will 
spare your lives if you promise never to rob my traps 
again.” 
_ “We promise and thank you,” said the rat and the 
snake. “We will always remember your kindness.” 
Now

qa_pairs.question: Who eventually marries the princess?
qa_pairs.answer: The man who was brought in despite being considered sickly
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: In Filipino culture, marriage is often seen as a union of families and social classes rather than just individual partners. The fact that this 'sickly' man, who may be perceived as unattractive or socially unacceptable, marries the princess suggests that love and compatibility are more valued than physical appearance or social status.

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang pangalan ng unang karakter sa kuwento?
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Si Masoy, isang halimbawa ng isang may-ari ng lupa na nagtatanim at nagsisipag-aral sa kaniyang mga kabuhayan sa loob ng liko.
qa_pairs.context:
The Monkey Who Became 
a Servant 
MASOY LIVED on a small clearing beside a forest in the 
Eastern Visayas. He raised fruits, beans, and ginger. Every 
morning he would go to the village to market his products, 
and with the money he got he would buy rice and other 
things for his daily needs. In this way he lived happily, 
envying no one. 
But early one morning when he went to his orchard to 
gather fruit, he saw his trees bare. “A thief must have 
climbed over my fence,” Masoy thought, so he ra

qa_pairs.question: Anong pangyayari nang mapatagak sa lupa ang babasahin na may pitch?
qa_pairs.answer: Nakatagpo ng monkey at kinailangan si Masoy na kumonti ng pera para sa pagkain niya
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Si Masoy ay nakapagtanto lamang sa kaniyang mga ginagawa at naging mapanira ng loob pagkatapos sumakop ang babasahin, na nagpapahiwatig ng kahalagahan ng diskarte at matiyagaang pagtitiyaga sa Pilipinas
qa_pairs.context:

qa_pairs.question: Who is Masoy?
qa_pairs.answer: Masoy had a naturally kind heart, and he pulled the monkey out of the pitch.
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Masoy, with his generous nature, exemplifies the Filipino value of bayanihan (collective unity) as seen in his willingness to take in the monkey and treat it like a family member.
qa_pairs.context:
will serve you well.” 
Masoy had a naturally kind heart, and he pulled the 
monkey out of the pitch. From that day on the monkey 
became Masoy’s servant. He did all the house work for 
Masoy and ran errands for him. 
One day on his way to the village the monkey found a 
piece of silver and a piece of gold lying ona river bank. He 
went to Masoy and asked, “Master, why don’t you get 
yourself a wife?” 
“Why should I get me a wife when I can hardly support 
myself?” said Masoy. 
“In that case, get

qa_pairs.question: What is the role of the village chief?
qa_pairs.answer: The village chief loaned the monkey a polished coconut shell used for measuring rice, and he was also asked to consider Masoy as his son-in-law.
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: In this context, the village chief embodies the Filipino concept of respeto (respect) by graciously lending the measure to the monkey and showing interest in getting to know Masoy better, highlighting the importance of community and social relationships in Filipino culture.

qa_pairs.question: Ano ang pangalan ng chief na nakatanggap ng pagbisita mula kay Masoy?
qa_pairs.answer: Ang pangalang chief ay hindi nagsasaad saan siya galing pero malamang isang pinuno o may-ari ng lupain
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang chief ay tumutukoy rin sa may-ari ng lupain at ang pagbisita ni Masoy ay nagpapahiwatig ng kanyang katayuan bilang tagasuporta ng mga katungkulan ng chief
qa_pairs.context:
path so the merchant would not see them. 
The chief saw Masoy and he was well pleased with him 
and asked, “Have you a palace?” 
The monkey made a sign to Masoy, and Masoy replied, 
“Yes, your Honor.” 
“I should like to come and pay you a visit,” said the 
chief. 
“It would be a great honor to me, sir,” replied Masoy, 
still following the monkey’s signals. 
“Would it be all right if I came this afternoon?” 
“Yes, sir. You would be very welcome, sir,” said Ma- 
Soy.

qa_pairs.question: Anong nangyari sa witch pagkatapos nitong makidig ng pilihang pinagsasabi ni Masoy?
qa_pairs.answer: Siya ay naputulan ng buhay at nakulong sa pit
qa_pairs.cultural_golden_answer: Ang kuwento ng monkey at witch ay nagpapahiwatig ng isang karaniwang tema sa mga alamat na Pilipino, kung saan ang mga may-ari ng kapangyarihan ay tinututukan ng mas mabibigat na balitaktakan ng mga demonyo o mga nilalayon
